A Decade of Rust, and Announcing Ferrocene

2023/07/19
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

Rust, a language that has been gaining popularity among developers over the past decade, has reached a major milestone. To celebrate this achievement, the Rust community is organizing a virtual event that will bring together Rustaceans from all over the world. This event will be a great opportunity for developers to connect and learn from each other.

But that's not all! The Rust team is also excited to announce the release of Ferrocene, a qualified version of the Rust compiler. Ferrocene is currently undergoing ISO 26262 and IEC 61508 qualification, making it a reliable and trustworthy tool for developers.

If you're eager to try out Ferrocene, you're in luck! The release candidate is already available for download. Simply reach out to the Ferrous Systems People through their contact form to get access.

In addition to the Ferrocene announcement, the article also mentions other interesting topics for developers, such as the update on Ferrocene testing and the challenges of learning a new programming language.

Stay tuned for more news and updates from the Rust community. Happy coding!

    println!("Hello, Rustaceans!");
